name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
work: The Social Contract, Emile, Discourse on Inequality
quote: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
fun-desc: Once abandoned his five children to orphanages while writing about ideal education. Also composed operas and loved botanizing.

name: Jean-Paul Sartre
work: Being and Nothingness, Nausea, No Exit
quote: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.
fun-desc: Declined the Nobel Prize in Literature. Had a famous open relationship with Simone de Beauvoir and loved jazz cafes.

name: Albert Camus
work: The Stranger, The Myth of Sisyphus, The Plague
fun-desc: Was a goalkeeper for a local football team in Algeria. Won the Nobel Prize at 44, then died in a car crash carrying an unused train ticket.

name: Michel Foucault
work: Discipline and Punish, The History of Sexuality, Madness and Civilization
quote: Where there is power, there is resistance.
fun-desc: Shaved his head to stand out in crowds. Was known for his theatrical lectures and loved California's counterculture scene.

name: Simone de Beauvoir
work: The Second Sex, The Ethics of Ambiguity, Memoirs of a Dutiful Daughter
quote: One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.
fun-desc: Traveled the world with Sartre but always kept her own apartment. Was buried with Sartre's letters and her lover's ring.

name: Rene Descartes
work: Meditations on First Philosophy, Discourse on the Method
fun-desc: Invented the Cartesian coordinate system while lying in bed watching a fly. Died of pneumonia after tutoring Queen Christina of Sweden at 5 AM.

name: Michel de Montaigne
fun-desc: Invented the essay as a literary form. Had his famous quotes inscribed on the ceiling beams of his tower library.

name: Etienne de La Boetie
quote: Resolve to serve no more, and you are at once freed.
fun-desc: Wrote his masterpiece on tyranny at just 18 years old. His friendship with Montaigne became legendary in philosophical circles.

name: Alexis de Tocqueville
work: Democracy in America, The Old Regime and the Revolution
quote: The greatness of America lies not in being more enlightened than any other nation, but rather in her ability to repair her faults.
fun-desc: Traveled across America for 9 months at age 25 and wrote the most influential book about American democracy.

name: Charles Baudelaire
work: Les Fleurs du mal, The Painter of Modern Life
quote: The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he did not exist.
fun-desc: Dyed his hair green once to shock the bourgeoisie. His poetry collection was prosecuted for obscenity.

name: Auguste Comte
work: Course of Positive Philosophy, A General View of Positivism
fun-desc: Founded sociology and positivism. Created a secular 'Religion of Humanity' with its own calendar of secular saints.

name: Andre Comte-Sponville
work: A Small Treatise on the Great Virtues, The Little Book of Atheist Spirituality
quote: The wise man has no need of hope. He acts.
fun-desc: One of France's most popular living philosophers. Known for making philosophy accessible to everyone through bestselling books.

name: Jacques Herbrand
work: Herbrand's Theorem, Contributions to Mathematical Logic
quote: Mathematics is not about numbers, equations, computations, or algorithms: it is about understanding.
fun-desc: Made groundbreaking contributions to mathematical logic before dying in a mountaineering accident at just 23 years old.
